questions.question: An administrator needs to rapidly deploy a popular IT solution and start using it immediately. Where can the administrator find assistance?
questions.explanation: AWS Quick Starts provide automated reference architectures and deployment templates that allow customers to quickly deploy popular solutions following AWS best practices.

questions.question: What is one of the advantages of the Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS)?

options.text: It simplifies relational database administration tasks.
It automatically scales databases for loads.
It enables users to dynamically adjust CPU and RAM resources.

questions.explanation: Amazon RDS is a managed service that automates common administrative tasks such as backups, patching, monitoring, and failover, reducing operational overhead.

questions.question: Which of the following AWS Cloud services can be used to run a customer-managed relational database?
questions.explanation: Running a customer-managed relational database requires full control of the OS and database software, which is provided by Amazon EC2.

questions.question: A user is planning to launch two additional Amazon EC2 instances to increase availability. Which action should the user take?

options.text: Launch the instances across multiple Availability Zones in a single AWS Region.
Launch the instances as EC2 Reserved Instances in the same AWS Region and the same Availability Zone.
Launch the instances in multiple AWS Regions but in the same Availability Zone.
Launch the instances as EC2 Spot Instances in the same AWS Region but in different Availability Zones.

questions.explanation: Placing instances in multiple Availability Zones protects against failure of a single data center, increasing availability.

questions.question: Which of the following can limit Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket access to specific users?

options.text: AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) policies.

questions.explanation: IAM policies control who can access AWS resources such as S3 buckets and what actions they are allowed to perform.

questions.question: Which AWS service allows companies to connect an Amazon VPC to an on-premises data center? (Select TWO)
questions.explanation: AWS VPN provides encrypted connections over the internet, and AWS Direct Connect provides a dedicated private connection between on-premises infrastructure and AWS.

questions.question: Which AWS service or feature can be used to monitor CPU usage?
questions.explanation: Amazon CloudWatch collects and tracks metrics such as CPU utilization, disk usage, and network activity for AWS resources.

questions.question: Which task is AWS responsible for in the shared responsibility model for security and compliance?

options.text: Granting access to individuals and services.

questions.explanation: AWS is responsible for the security of the cloud, including the physical infrastructure and underlying hardware such as EC2 host firmware.

questions.question: Which of the following security-related actions are available at no cost?

options.text: Contacting AWS Professional Services to request a workshop.
Attending AWS classes at a local university.

questions.explanation: AWS provides free access to a large amount of documentation, whitepapers, forums, blogs, and security best-practice guides. These resources are always available at no cost.

questions.question: Which storage service can be used as a low-cost option for hosting static websites?
questions.explanation: Amazon S3 is designed for storing and serving static files and can be used to host static websites at very low cost with high durability and availability.

questions.question: According to the AWS shared responsibility model what is the sole responsibility of AWS?
questions.explanation: AWS is solely responsible for managing and operating edge locations, which are part of AWS global infrastructure used for services like CloudFront.

questions.question: Which of the following are pillars of the AWS Well-Architected Framework? (Select TWO)
questions.explanation: Performance efficiency and Security are two of the core pillars of the AWS Well-Architected Framework. They guide how workloads should be built and operated in AWS.

questions.question: Which AWS service identifies security groups that allow unrestricted access to a user’s AWS resources?
questions.explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor analyzes AWS environments and provides security recommendations, including identifying security groups that allow unrestricted access.

questions.question: Which design principles for cloud architecture are recommended when re-architecting a large monolithic application? (Select TWO)
questions.explanation: Loose coupling allows components to fail independently, and designing for scalability ensures the system can grow as demand increases—both are key cloud design principles.

questions.question: When architecting cloud applications, which of the following are a key design principle?
questions.explanation: Elasticity allows applications to automatically grow or shrink resources based on demand, which is a core benefit of cloud computing.

questions.question: A company has deployed several relational databases on Amazon EC2 instances. Every month the database software vendor releases new security patches that need to be applied to the databases. What is the MOST efficient way to apply the security patches?

options.text: Connect to each database instance on a monthly basis and download and apply the necessary security patches from the vendor.
Enable automate patching for the instances using the Amazon RDS console.
In AWS Config. configure a rule for the instances and the required patch level.
Use AWS Systems Manager to automate database patching according to a schedule.

questions.explanation: AWS Systems Manager allows you to automate patching across many EC2 instances according to a schedule, making it the most efficient and scalable approach.

questions.question: Which mechanism allows developers to access AWS services from application code?
questions.explanation: The AWS SDK allows developers to programmatically access and interact with AWS services from their application code.

questions.question: Which AWS feature will reduce the customer’s total cost of ownership (TCO)?
questions.explanation: Elastic computing allows customers to only pay for what they use and scale resources as needed, which significantly reduces total cost of ownership.

questions.question: Which of the following is a benefit of using the AWS Cloud?

options.text: Permissive security removes the administrative burden.
Ability to focus on revenue-generating activities.
Choice of specific cloud hardware vendors.

questions.explanation: AWS lets companies focus on business value instead of managing infrastructure, allowing them to spend more time on revenue-generating activities.

questions.question: Which of the following are categories of AWS Trusted Advisor? (Select TWO)
questions.explanation: Fault tolerance and Performance are two of the categories used by AWS Trusted Advisor to analyze and optimize AWS environments.

questions.question: What is Amazon CloudWatch?

options.text: A code repository with customizable build and team commit features.
A metrics repository with customizable notification thresholds and channels.
A security configuration repository with threat analytics.
A rule repository of a web application firewall with automated vulnerability prevention features.

questions.explanation: Amazon CloudWatch is a monitoring service that stores metrics and allows customers to create alarms and notifications based on thresholds.

questions.question: Under the AWS shared responsibility model, which of the following activities are the customer’s responsibility? (Select TWO)

options.text: Patching operating system components for Amazon Relational Database Server (Amazon RDS).
Maintaining environmental controls within a data center.

questions.explanation: Customers are responsible for encrypting their own data and configuring network controls such as Network ACLs, while AWS manages the physical infrastructure.

questions.question: Under the shared responsibility model, which of the following is a shared control between a customer and AWS?
questions.explanation: Patch management is a shared responsibility because AWS patches the infrastructure while customers patch the operating systems and applications they manage.

questions.question: Which AWS service is used to pay AWS bills, and monitor usage and budget costs?
questions.explanation: AWS Billing and Cost Management provides tools to view, pay, and monitor AWS bills and budgets.

questions.question: How do customers benefit from Amazon’s massive economies of scale?

options.text: Periodic price reductions as the result of Amazon’s operational efficiencies.
New Amazon EC2 instance types providing the latest hardware.
The ability to scale up and down when needed.
Increased reliability in the underlying hardware of Amazon EC2 instances.

questions.explanation: AWS passes its operational efficiencies to customers in the form of frequent price reductions due to its massive economies of scale.

questions.question: Which AWS feature allows a company to take advantage of usage tiers for services across multiple member accounts?
questions.explanation: Consolidated billing allows multiple AWS accounts to combine usage and receive volume discounts across the organization.

questions.question: Which AWS services provide a way to extend an on-premises architecture to the aws cloud? (Select TWO)
questions.explanation: AWS Storage Gateway and AWS Direct Connect both extend on-premises environments into AWS, enabling hybrid cloud architectures.

questions.question: Which of the following services will automatically scale with an expected increase in web traffic?
questions.explanation: Elastic Load Balancing automatically scales to handle incoming web traffic and distributes it across multiple targets.

questions.question: Which service provides a virtually unlimited amount of online highly durable object storage?
questions.explanation: Amazon S3 provides virtually unlimited, highly durable object storage, making it ideal for storing large volumes of data.

questions.question: Which AWS feature should a customer leverage to achieve high availability of an application?
questions.explanation: Availability Zones provide physically separate data centers that allow applications to remain available even if one zone fails.

questions.question: Which AWS service or feature can enhance network security by blocking requests from a particular network for a web application on AWS? (Select TWO)
questions.explanation: AWS WAF blocks malicious web requests, and Network ACLs control inbound and outbound traffic at the subnet level to enhance network security.

questions.question: Which of the following is a cloud architectural design principle?
questions.explanation: Loosely coupled components allow systems to be more resilient, scalable, and easier to maintain in the cloud.

questions.question: Which service enables risk auditing by continuously monitoring and logging account activity, including user actions in the AWS Management Console and AWS SDKs?
questions.explanation: AWS CloudTrail logs all API calls and user activity, providing full auditing and risk monitoring.

questions.question: Where can AWS compliance and certification reports be downloaded?
questions.explanation: AWS Artifact provides access to compliance reports, certifications, and audit documentation.

questions.question: The financial benefits of using AWS are: (Select TWO)
questions.explanation: AWS reduces both total cost of ownership (TCO) and operational expenditure (OPEX) by eliminating the need for customers to manage physical infrastructure.

questions.question: Which AWS service can serve a static website?
questions.explanation: Amazon S3 can host static websites by serving HTML, CSS, and JavaScript files directly from a bucket.

questions.question: What are the benefits of using the AWS Cloud for companies with customers in many countries around the world (Select TWO)

options.text: Companies can deploy applications in multiple AWS Regions to reduce latency.
Amazon Translate automatically translates third-party website interfaces into multiple languages.
Amazon CloudFront has multiple edge locations around the world to reduce latency.
Amazon Comprehend allows users to build applications that can respond to user requests in many languages.
Elastic Load Balancing can distribute application web traffic to multiple AWS Regions around the world which reduces latency.

questions.explanation: AWS Regions and CloudFront edge locations reduce latency by serving users from locations closer to them geographically.

questions.question: Which of the following are main components of the AWS global infrastructure? (Select TWO)
questions.explanation: Regions and Availability Zones are the primary building blocks of the AWS global infrastructure.

questions.question: What is the AWS customer responsible for according to the AWS shared responsibility model?
questions.explanation: Customers are responsible for encrypting their data, while AWS handles physical and environmental security.

questions.question: If each department within a company has its own AWS account, what is one way to enable consolidated billing?

options.text: Use AWS Budgets on each account to pay only to budget.
Contact AWS Support for a monthly bill.
Create an AWS Organization from the payer account and invite the other accounts to join.
Put all invoices into one Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket, load data into Amazon Redshift, and then run a billing report.

questions.explanation: AWS Organizations allows multiple AWS accounts to be linked together for centralized billing and management.

questions.question: What costs are included when comparing AWS Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) with on-premises TCO?
questions.explanation: AWS TCO comparisons include the cost of physical data center security, which is removed when migrating to AWS.

questions.question: What is the benefit of using AWS managed services, such as Amazon ElastiCache and Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS)?

options.text: They require the customer to monitor and replace failing instances.
They have better performance than customer-managed services.
They simplify patching and updating underlying OSs.
They do not require the customer to optimize instance type or size selections.

questions.explanation: AWS managed services handle operating system patching and maintenance, reducing administrative overhead for customers.

questions.question: Which services can be used across hybrid AWS Cloud architectures? (Select TWO)
questions.explanation: Amazon Route 53 and Virtual Private Gateway both work in hybrid cloud architectures connecting AWS and on-premises networks.

questions.question: Which statement best describes Elastic Load Balancing?

options.text: It translates a domain name into an IP address using DNC.
It distributes incoming application traffic across one or more Amazon EC2 instances.
It collects metrics on connected Amazon EC2 instances.
It automatically adjusts the number of Amazon EC2 instances to support incoming traffic.

questions.explanation: Elastic Load Balancing distributes incoming traffic across multiple EC2 instances to improve availability and reliability.

questions.question: Which of the following is a fast and reliable NoSQL database service?
questions.explanation: Amazon DynamoDB is a fully managed, high-performance NoSQL database service.

questions.question: Which AWS service would you use to obtain compliance reports and certificates?
questions.explanation: AWS Artifact provides customers with access to AWS compliance reports and certifications.

questions.question: Which AWS services are defined as global instead of regional? (Select TWO)
questions.explanation: Amazon Route 53 and CloudFront are global services, meaning they are not tied to a specific AWS Region.

questions.question: How would an AWS customer easily apply common access controls to a large set of users?

options.text: Apply an IAM policy to an IAM group.
Apply an IAM policy to an IAM role.
Apply the same IAM policy to all IAM users with access to the same workload.
Apply an IAM policy to an Amazon Cognito user pool.

questions.explanation: IAM groups allow administrators to apply policies to many users at once, simplifying permission management.

questions.question: Which of the following is an important architectural design principle when designing cloud applications?
questions.explanation: Using multiple Availability Zones is a core design principle to achieve high availability in cloud architectures.

questions.question: Which service allows a company with multiple AWS accounts to combine its usage to obtain volume discounts?
questions.explanation: AWS Organizations allows multiple accounts to combine their usage, qualifying them for volume discounts.
